entry.tran: 超然的;冷漠的;不带感情的
entry.def: Someone who is detached is not personally involved in something or has no emotional interest in it.

example.ex: He tries to remain emotionally detached from the prisoners, but fails...
example.tran: 他试图不带感情地对待那些犯人，但是做不到。

example.ex: It is written in a detached, precise style.
example.tran: 行文冷静客观，一针见血。

entry.def: A detached house is one that is not joined to any other house.

sentences.sentence: "adopted a degage pose on the arm of the easy chair"- J.S.Perelman
"she may be detached or even unfeeling but at least she's not hypocritically effusive"

means.word_mean: 2. being or feeling set or kept apart from others;

sentences.sentence: "could not remain the isolated figure he had been"- Sherwood Anderson
"thought of herself as alone and separated from the others"
"on one side of the island was a hugh rock, almost detached"
"the separated spacecraft will return to their home bases"

means.word_mean: 4. used of buildings; standing apart from others;

sentences.sentence: "he pulled his arm free and ran"

Sentence.sentence: Most young boys are trained to believe that men should be strong, tough, cool, and detached.
They look at the world in a detached manner.

sentences.en: The coupon is not valid if detached.
Through all the arguments among other committee members, she kept a detached attitude.
sentences.cn: 在其他委员会成员辩论时, 她始终保持超然的态度。
